column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////The decor and ambience of the place is pretty trendy
column2: and the lighting was kinda dim for a good portion of the meal. The pricing of the food is slightly high
column3: but nothing exorbitant. The wait staff was helpful in providing good suggestions
column4: and the service was fine. I think one of the best attributes outside of the food is the location - since I live near the Med Center
column5: there aren't many ramen places as accessible as Jinya. Jinya is a place I would love to come back to several times to explore the menu - the quality of the food seems to be quite high
column6: which I have great appreciation for. It also appears to be a national chain
column7: so that could be a positive reinforcement of the reputability for some. You should definitely try it
column8: and I think it would be a great place to set your standard for Japanese ramen.
